title: Honeymoon horror: Sonam’s ‘lover’ worked in brother’s firm; cops dig deeper into husband's murder
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi, wife of Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi, has been arrested in Uttar Pradesh for allegedly orchestrating her husband's murder during their Meghalaya honeymoon. Police claim she conspired with her lover and hired killers. Three men have also been arrested, confessing to the crime. Sonam's father insists on her innocence and demands a CBI probe.

title: Meghalaya honeymoon murder twist: 'Sonam suddenly surfaced,' say cops
content: Meghalaya Police clarified that Sonam Raghuvanshi voluntarily surrendered at Nandganj Police Station in Ghazipur, Uttar Pradesh, in connection with the honeymoon murder case. She is currently under the safe custody of the Uttar Pradesh Police, and legal procedures are being followed for her transit and formal statement, as confirmed by Deputy CM Prestone Tynsong.

title: Watch: Oz reporter hit by rubber bullet while covering LA riots
content: While reporting live on anti-immigration protests in Los Angeles, 9News US correspondent Lauren Tomasi was struck in the leg by a rubber bullet fired by an LAPD officer. The incident, captured on camera, occurred as police moved in on horseback to disperse protesters.

title: Ex-England captain's big statement on Shubman Gill
content: Following Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's retirements, Shubman Gill, 25, has been named India's Test captain, a move Michael Vaughan considers bold. Gill will lead India in the upcoming five-match series against England, marking the start of the WTC 2025-27 cycle. Vaughan believes this tour could usher in a new era for Indian Test cricket, with Rishabh Pant as vice-captain.

title: Watch: Fire breaks out on ship off Kerala coast; 18 crew abandon burning container
content: A fire erupted on the Singapore-flagged container ship MV Wan Hai 503 off the Kerala coast, prompting a swift response from the Indian Navy. Four crew members are missing, and five are injured following the underdeck fire, which was reported on Monday morning. INS Surat has been diverted to assist, and a Dornier aircraft will assess the situation.

title: Steve Jobs tip to Apple CEO Tim Cook: Never to stay 'married' to my past ...; a skill Cook says he learnt late
content: Tim Cook credits Steve Jobs with teaching him the invaluable skill of rapidly changing his mind when presented with new evidence, a trait powered by emotional intelligence. Jobs's ability to shift direction and let go of pride influenced Cook and many others, including Jeff Bezos, Jony Ive, and Marc Benioff.

title: These 3 uncapped stars will 'definitely' make India's WC squad
content: Robin Uthappa believes young talents Priyansh Arya, Prabhsimran Singh, and Vaibhav Suryavanshi are strong contenders for India's T20 World Cup squad. Their explosive IPL performances have created a selection dilemma, with Shubman Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Abhishek Sharma and Sanju Samson also in contention. Uthappa emphasizes using remaining T20s to finalize the best 15, prioritizing fitness alongside form.

title: India tour of England: Pujara and Nehra reveal key to success
content: As India embarks on a new era in Test cricket under Shubman Gill's captaincy, former cricketers emphasize the importance of adapting to English conditions for a successful tour. With veterans like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli retired, Cheteshwar Pujara urges every player to contribute.

title: JD Vance on Musk-Trump fight: Hopefully Elon figures it out …, President was frustrated but …
content: US Vice President JD Vance has commented on the public dispute between Donald Trump and Elon Musk, expressing concern over the implications of their disagreement. Vance believes Musk made a mistake by attacking Trump and hopes he will "come back into the fold." He acknowledged Trump's frustration but noted his restraint.

title: Chambal's haunted ravines: Secret shooting range found; become training hub for gangs
content: The Chambal ravines, once hideouts for bandits, are now training grounds for organized crime, as revealed by the arrest of gangster Jeetu Chambal. He operated a makeshift shooting range used by interstate gangs, including those linked to Lawrence Bishnoi and Anandpal Singh, to train sharpshooters.

title: 'Thug Life' BO collection day 5: Kamal Haasan starrer slows down after weekend surge
content: Kamal Haasan's 'Thug Life,' directed by Mani Ratnam, opened strongly with ₹15.5 crore but faced mixed reviews regarding pacing and screenplay. Collections sharply declined after the first day, with a slight weekend recovery before a significant drop on Day 5. The film's five-day total stands at ₹38.03 crore, with its future success dependent on wider audience appeal.

title: 'Falsely implicated': RCB moves HC to quash criminal case in B'luru stampede
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru has petitioned the Karnataka High Court to dismiss a criminal case related to the June 4 stampede outside Chinnaswamy Stadium, which resulted in 11 deaths. The tragedy occurred amidst celebrations for RCB's anticipated IPL victory. Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah expressed sorrow, suspended police officers, and initiated an investigation into the incident.

title: Tesla Optimus chief resigns: Thanks Elon Musk in his farewell post on Twitter; says ‘You have …'
content: Milan Kovac, Tesla's Optimus robot project head, has resigned to spend more time with family abroad after nine years with the company. This transition occurs as Tesla intensifies its focus on autonomous technology and robotics. Ashok Elluswamy, currently leading Tesla’s Autopilot team, will assume Kovac’s responsibilities amidst challenges like rare-earth magnet export restrictions.

title: 'Automatic door closer': Railways take major decision after many fall from Mumbai train
content: Following a tragic incident where passengers fell from an overcrowded local train, Indian Railways has mandated automatic door-closing mechanisms for all new rakes manufactured for Mumbai's suburban network. Existing rakes will also be redesigned to include this safety feature. This decision aims to prevent accidents caused by open doors and improve passenger safety on Mumbai's busy local trains.

title: T20 Mumbai League: Prithvi Shaw smashes 34-ball 75 vs Suryakumar’s team - Watch
content: Prithvi Shaw's explosive 75 off 34 balls propelled North Mumbai Panthers to a resounding victory against Triumph Knights in the T20 Mumbai League. Despite the win, the Panthers missed the playoffs, while Shaw's aggressive innings, featuring 12 fours and 3 sixes, set the stage for a large first innings total.

title: Meghalaya honeymoon murder mystery: Missing wife found near UP dhaba; three hitmen arrested
content: In a shocking turn of events, Indore resident Raja Raghuvanshi was murdered during his honeymoon in Meghalaya, orchestrated by his wife, Sonam. Meghalaya DGP I Nongrang confirmed Sonam's surrender in Uttar Pradesh, along with the arrest of three assailants from Madhya Pradesh.

title: Move away from China: Shein & Reliance aim selling ‘Made in India’ clothes abroad
content: Shein partners with Reliance Retail to expand its Indian manufacturing network, aiming to increase suppliers to 1,000 within a year. This collaboration will facilitate the production of Shein-branded apparel in India for both domestic sales and international distribution.

title: 'Disappointment': Akram's statue unveiled in Hyderabad; triggers hilarious reactions
content: A life-sized statue honoring cricket legend Wasim Akram in Hyderabad, Pakistan has sparked amusement online. Intended as a tribute, the statue, depicting Akram in his 1999 World Cup jersey, has been widely mocked for its unflattering resemblance. Fans humorously compared it to other statue mishaps, referencing Sachin Tendulkar's statue in Mumbai.

title: Wife ‘surrenders’, 3 others arrested: How police cracked Meghalaya honeymoon murder case
content: In a shocking twist to the Meghalaya murder case, Sonam Raghuvanshi allegedly confessed to plotting her husband Raja's murder during their honeymoon in Shillong. Meghalaya DGP I Nongrang stated Sonam hired assailants to kill Raja. Sonam surrendered in Ghazipur, UP, while three others were arrested. The couple was last seen near living root bridges before Raja's body was discovered.

title: Honeymoon murder: Sonam came on foot, asked for mobile - what UP dhaba owner told cops
content: In a significant development, Sonam Raghuvanshi, the prime suspect in her husband Raja's murder during their Meghalaya honeymoon, has surrendered to Uttar Pradesh police. Located near Ghazipur, she's now under protective custody awaiting transfer to Meghalaya for interrogation. Police have arrested three alleged hitmen, who confessed to being hired by Sonam.

title: Baba Vanga warned us! Alien UFO sighting could disrupt a major 2025 sports event live on TV
content: Baba Vanga's 2025 prediction about a 'new light in the sky' during a globally viewed sports event has resurfaced, fueling speculation about extraterrestrial contact. With events like Wimbledon, the World Series, and Formula 1 still to come, believers watch for a sign. Recent UFO disclosures and South American alien DNA claims add to the intrigue, though some suggest the 'light' could be a celestial event like a supernova.

title: Housefull 5 box office collection: Akshay starrer expected to cross Rs 100cr
content: Housefull 5, released on June 6th, had a strong opening weekend, grossing ₹89.28 crore in India. The comedy franchise saw growth, especially on Sunday, despite mixed reviews. While Monday's early numbers show a drop, the film is expected to cross ₹100 crore soon. As the most expensive Indian comedy, its performance throughout the week will determine its success.

title: Iran, Afghanistan & more: Trump’s new travel ban kicks in; all you need to know
content: US president Trump's expanded travel ban, effective Monday, restricts entry for citizens from 12 countries, primarily in Africa and the Middle East. The administration cites terrorism and overstay concerns, though critics denounce the policy as discriminatory. Exemptions exist for journalists, students, and those needing urgent medical care. Venezuela's government has condemned the ban as a "stigmatisation and criminalisation campaign".

title: Director Partho Ghosh dies at 75 due to heart attack
content: Partho Ghosh, the veteran filmmaker celebrated for his memorable Hindi films of the 1990s, has sadly passed away at 75 due to a heart attack. Known for directing hits like '100 Days,' 'Dalaal,' and 'Agni Sakshi,' Ghosh left a significant mark on Bollywood with his diverse storytelling. His contributions to Indian cinema are mourned by colleagues and fans alike.

title: India’s 5th gen fighter: GE says ‘very interested’; speeds up Tejas Mark-1A engine delivery
content: General Electric (GE) is vying to supply engines for India's fifth-generation stealth fighter project, viewing India as a crucial strategic market. GE also aims to accelerate F-404 engine deliveries to HAL for the Tejas Mark-1A fighter program, addressing previous delays.

title: India's home season: BCCI revises schedule, swaps Delhi and Kolkata Test venues
content: The BCCI has revised venues for the 2025 home season, moving the India-South Africa Test from Delhi to Kolkata due to air quality concerns. Consequently, the India-West Indies Test shifts from Kolkata to Delhi. Outfield renovations in Chennai prompt a change in venue for the India Women vs Australia Women ODI series, with matches now in New Chandigarh and Delhi.

title: Tristan Stubbs could be South Africa's 'X-factor', feels Mathew Hayden
content: Matthew Hayden believes Tristan Stubbs could be South Africa's 'X-factor' in the World Test Championship final against Australia, drawing comparisons to Kevin Pietersen. Stubbs, who may bat at number five, recently played for Delhi Capitals in the IPL 2025, scoring 300 runs.

title: Honeymoon murder case: 'Wife hired killers', say cops; 'Sonam innocent,' claims family
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi's father claims her innocence after she was arrested for allegedly hiring people to kill her husband during their honeymoon in Meghalaya. He accuses the Meghalaya Police of fabricating the story and plans to request a CBI inquiry.

title: IND vs ENG: What Team India will do in England today; series begins June 20
content: Team India gears up for the crucial Test series against England with an important training session in Beckenham. Led by Shubman Gill and coached by Gautam Gambhir, the squad is acclimatising to English conditions before a scheduled rest day. The team's preparation includes warm-up drills and sprint sessions, setting the stage for the first Test at Headingley.

title: WTC Final: How Bumrah's message eased Green's doubts; terms it 'special'
content: Ahead of his back surgery, Cameron Green received reassuring words from Jasprit Bumrah, who had undergone a similar procedure. Bumrah's comeback and performance inspired Green, boosting his confidence. Green, now recovered, is set to play in the WTC Final as a specialist batter, potentially batting at No. 3 for Australia.

title: Watch: One of the most bizarre run-outs ever – keeper hits both ends with one throw
content: In an MPL 2025 match, Raigad Royals' Harsh Mogaveera suffered a freak run-out against Puneri Bappa. After the wicket-keeper's throw hit the stumps at the striker's end, the ball ricocheted to the non-striker's end, dislodging the bails and finding Mogaveera short of his ground. This bizarre dismissal has quickly gone viral, stunning players and fans alike.

title: Drama in TNPL! Ashwin loses cool after dismissal; argues with female umpire - Watch
content: Ravichandran Ashwin found himself embroiled in controversy during a TNPL 2025 match after being dismissed LBW. Disagreeing with the umpire's decision, Ashwin engaged in a heated argument, which was captured on video and went viral. Replays suggested the ball might have pitched outside leg, adding fuel to the debate as Dindigul Dragons suffered a batting collapse and a heavy defeat.

title: Mumbai railway tragedy: 5 dead, several injured after falling from moving local train
content: A tragic incident occurred between Diva and Mumbra stations, resulting in the death of five passengers and injuries to several others who fell from an overcrowded local train. The accident happened when two trains crossed paths, causing passengers on the footboards to collide and lose their balance.

title: Gold price prediction for June 9 - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices have fluctuated amid global uncertainty, reaching near four-week highs, while silver surpassed ₹1 lakh. Escalating geopolitical tensions and US-China trade discussions influence investor sentiment. Weaker US economic data raises stagflation concerns, but a resilient labor market keeps sentiment mixed.

title: Watch: Inside look at Rinku Singh and Priya Saroj’s engagement; couple's dance goes viral
content: Indian cricketer Rinku Singh and Samajwadi Party MP Priya Saroj celebrated their engagement in a lavish ceremony in Lucknow, attended by prominent political figures like Akhilesh Yadav and Jaya Bachchan. The couple's union blends the worlds of sports and politics, marking a significant moment as they embark on their journey together.

title: BSF unveils new uniforms; smart tech deployed on Pakistan, Bangladesh fronts
content: BSF soldiers guarding the Bangladesh and Pakistan borders will soon sport new combat uniforms made of a more comfortable and flexible fabric blend. The updated uniform, featuring a digital pattern, is designed for improved breathability and stretch. Simultaneously, the Rajasthan border is being reinforced with smart fencing and advanced surveillance technology, including upgraded CCTVs and intrusion detection systems.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 crosses 25,100; BSE Sensex up over 400 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday. While Nifty50 went above 25,100, BSE Sensex was up over 400 points.

title: French Open: Alcaraz channels his three C's to top Sinner; wins fifth major title
content: Carlos Alcaraz triumphed over Jannik Sinner in the longest French Open final in history, winning 4-6, 6-7, 6-4, 7-6, 7-6 after five hours and 29 minutes. Down two sets and three championship points, Alcaraz staged a stunning comeback, capturing his fifth Grand Slam title at just 22. This first major final in their rivalry delivered a generational classic.

title: IAS officer held for taking Rs 10L bribe; Rs 47L seized from house during raid
content: In Odisha, vigilance officials apprehended IAS officer Dhiman Chakma, the sub-collector of Dharamgarh, for allegedly accepting a ₹10 lakh bribe from a businessman in Kalahandi. Authorities caught Chakma red-handed at his government residence following a complaint. Subsequent searches uncovered an additional ₹47 lakh in unaccounted cash at his official residence.

title: Vijay Mallya performed Sameera Reddy’s ‘Kanyadaan’; here’s how they’re related
content: Amidst Vijay Mallya's controversies, a surprising detail resurfaced: he performed the kanyadaan at Sameera Reddy's intimate 2014 wedding. The actress revealed Mallya's role, highlighting the close-knit ceremony with family and friends. Now, celebrating 11 years of marriage with Akshai Varde, Sameera has shifted her focus to body positivity and parenting content, engaging with fans online.

title: Watch: Unreal moment in cricket! Batter on 98 bowled, but bails don't fall
content: A Big Cricket League match in Surat witnessed a bizarre incident when batter Chirag Gandhi, on 98, hit his stumps, but the bail miraculously remained in place. Despite the lucky break, UP Brij Stars failed to chase MP Tigers' 239-run target. Gandhi remained unbeaten on 101, but his team fell short, highlighting cricket's unpredictable nature.

title: B'luru stampede: Siddaramaiah blames police; denies govt role
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah distanced his government from the stampede deaths following an RCB victory celebration, blaming mismanagement by the police, KSCA, and RCB. He stated he was only informed of the incident nearly two hours after it occurred and had only approved the Vidhana Soudha event.

title: Can ECI announce date by which electoral-roll data of Haryana, Maharashtra will be handed over: Rahul Gandhi
content: Rahul Gandhi had alleged "match-fixing" in the Maharashtra polls and claimed that it would next happen in the Bihar election and "anywhere the BJP is losing".

title: Modi has survived through publicity, his government failed to fulfil promises, says Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah
content: On June 9, when asked by mediapersons in Mysuru to comment on the Modi government completing 11 years in power, Mr. Siddaramaiah said, “I give zero marks to the government headed by Mr. Modi”

title: Row over ‘relaxation’ of contractual posting rule for Kerala Speaker A.N. Shamseer’s wife at Kannur University
content: Kannur University Senators Forum submits formal petition to Vice Chancellor, demanding uniform application of rule

title: Missing minor girl from Uttar Pradesh rescued in Tumakuru
content: The girl claimed to have left her hometown with a male friend because her parents had fixed her marriage against her consent

title: Madras High Court advices Chennai Commissioner of Police not to send investigating officers on bandobust duty
content: Justice P. Velmurugan says officers investigating criminal cases must be allowed to concentrate and conclude the probe on time

title: Amit Shah’s speech in Madurai abominable, divisive and misleading: DMK leader A. Raja
content: When asked about the Lord Murugan conference (Murugan maanadu) being planned by the BJP in Madurai (on June 22), he charged that BJP’s motive was to incite communal sentiments against minorities.

title: Supreme Court refuses urgent hearing on plea for protection of theatres screening 'Thug Life' in Karnataka
content: The Tamil movie, which reunites the 70-year-old actor with filmmaker Mani Ratnam after 1987's "Nayakan", could not be released in Karnataka after Kamal Haasan's comments about Kannada language sparked a major controversy

title: Bengaluru stadium stampede: RCB moves Karnataka High Court seeking to quash criminal case
content: DNA Entertainment Networks Private Limited, the event organiser, has filed a separate petition challenging the FIR against the company

title: Singapore-flagged cargo ship catches fire off Beypore coast in Kerala; rescue mission underway
content: Kerala State Disaster Management Authority officials confirm 22 crew members on board the Singapore-flagged feeder vessel that was on the way to Mumbai from Colombo with over 650 containers

title: Boy’s death in Nilambur: Congress seeks Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan’s response on Forest Minister’s ‘conspiracy’ remark
content: Boy was electrocuted by illegal electrical trap meant for wild boars, and Forest Minister A.K. Saseendran had alleged a ‘conspiracy’ in protests staged against the incident by Opposition parties

title: Adityanath 'lacks courage' to face farmers on ground: Akhilesh Yadav
content: The remarks come amid growing complaints from farmers about crop damage due to unseasonal rains and the menace of stray cattle, an issue that has remained a concern in rural Uttar Pradesh

title: Senior journalist Kommineni Srinivasa Rao arrested after controversial Sakshi TV debate
content: The arrests follows the controversy after a debate with V.V.R. Krishnam Raju, a journalist and political analyst in Sakshi TV recently; police are on look out for Mr. Raju

title: Good governance of PM Modi will be written in golden letters, says Nadda
content: Nadda cited Article 370 repeal, abolition of triple talaq, Waqf amendment, demonetisation, women quota bill among bold decisions of the BJP govfernment.

title: Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu condemns journalist Krishnam Raju’s remarks against women farmers
content: A.P. Chief Minister Chandrabau Naidu warned that all those who crossed all boundaries in hurting the sentiments of women as part of a malicious conspiracy against the capital would face serious consequences.

title: 11 years of Modi govt 'golden period' of resolve, dedication towards public service: Amit Shah
content: Amit Shah said these 11 years have also proved to be a milestone in the direction of national security

title: Union Agriculture Minister Shivaraj Singh Chouhan says India will be turned into food basket of the world
content: Union Agriculture Minister addresses farmers at ICAR-IIHR campus in Hessarghatta in Bengaluru city outskirts as part of Viksit Krishi Sankalp Abhiyan

title: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta plants ‘sindoor’ sapling at government school
content: Rekha Gupta said the previous AAP government did not plant trees as part of the 'Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam' campaign in Delhi

title: Landslip detected near Chooralmala in Kerala’s Wayanad; no casualties reported
content: The landslip took place during heavy rain on May 28, but was discovered by authorities only on May 30

title: Supreme Court refuses urgent hearing to T.N.’s plea against Centre over education funds
content: The suit, filed through Tamil Nadu State counsel Sabarish Subramanian, had submitted that the Samagra Shiksha Scheme was not connected to the NEP-2020 and PM Shri Schools’ Scheme in any way.

title: Sharnbasva University students selected for elite training at Bajaj BEST Centre in Bengaluru
content: Each student is assured of job placement upon completion of the programme, supported by regular campus recruitment drives conducted by leading companies

title: IAS officer caught while 'accepting bribe' of ₹10 lakh in Odisha
content: The department has registered a case against him under the Prevention of Corruption Act, and investigation is continuing

title: AICTE releases guidelines to integrate apprenticeship training into engineering and diploma programmes in India
content: The permissible embedded apprenticeship is a minimum of two semesters for engineering degree and one semester for diploma

title: World’s largest container ship MSC Irina docks at Vizhinjam seaport in Kerala
content: MSC Irina, which will be berthed at the port till June 10, boasts an impressive capacity of 24,346 TEUs, making it a formidable player in global shipping

title: Mumbai train accident: Four dead after falling off local train due to overcrowding
content: The railway administration and police have reached the spot and the injured are taken to the nearest hospital.

title: SGA's MVP performance lifts OKC to Game 2 win
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 34 points in a decisive Game 2 victory, bringing his total over his first two Finals games to an NBA-record 72 points.

title: Judge homers off Red Sox rookie after jab at Yanks
content: Aaron Judge hit one of his two home runs Sunday night off Red Sox rookie Hunter Dobbins, whose recent comment that he'd rather retire than play for New York made waves. As Judge said, "I've only heard Ken Griffey say that, so I was a little surprised."

title: Alcaraz rallies in French thriller: 'Just believed'
content: Carlos Alcaraz came back from two sets down and saved three match points to beat Jannik Sinner on Sunday and retain the French Open title.

title: Sources: RB Chubb expected to sign with Texans
content: Four-time Pro Bowl running back Nick Chubb is expected to sign a one-year deal with the Texans on Monday, sources told ESPN.

title: Sky's Vandersloot out for season with ACL tear
content: Veteran Sky point guard Courtney Vandersloot will miss the rest of the 2025 season after tearing her right ACL, the team announced Sunday.

title: Rays' Franco charged with gun possession in D.R.
content: Rays shortstop Wander Franco, who's on trial on charges that include sexual abuse of a minor, was charged Sunday with illegal possession of a handgun.

title: Skenes pitches another gem, again without win
content: Paul Skenes pitched another gem but again walked away without a win. This time, the Pirates ace didn't mind as Pittsburgh was able to pull away.

title: Tearful Ronaldo says 'duty done' after 2nd NL win
content: Portugal skipper Cristiano Ronaldo shed tears of joy as they won their second Nations League title on Sunday, insisting that winning trophies with his country beats all club honors.

title: 💰 $2.8B settlement lets colleges pay athletes
content: Schools are now free to begin paying their athletes directly, marking the dawn of a new era in college sports brought about by a multibillion-dollar legal settlement that was formally approved Friday.

title: Stanley Cup Final odds: Panthers favored to win series after Game 2 win
content: Top ways to bet the series and props for the Stanley Cup Final between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers.

title: Portugal's impressive Nations League win over Spain outshines Ronaldo vs. Yamal
content: Ronaldo vs. Yamal was the story heading into Sunday's UEFA Nations League final, but Portugal's collective quality won the day -- and the headlines -- over Spain's impressive young talent.

title: Turkey loss gives Poch, USMNT more questions than answers
content: In its first pre-Gold Cup tuneup, the short-handed USMNT looked no closer to fixing its uninspired play.

title: Spectator dies at Nations League final after fall
content: UEFA has confirmed the death of a spectator during Portugal's Nations League final win against Spain in Munich on Sunday.

title: Portugal's Mendes: I 'cancelled out' Yamal in final
content: Nuno Mendes backed Paris Saint-Germain teammate Ousmane Dembélé for this year's Ballon d'Or after saying he "cancelled out" Lamine Yamal during Portugal's UEFA Nations League final win against Spain.

title: MLS, players still at odds on CWC compensation
content: The discussions between MLS and the MLS Players Association over the Club World Cup prize money and player compensation remain ongoing, with the two sides failing to agree so far on terms in a newly revised section of the CBA.

title: Lewandowski boycotting Poland after captain snub
content: Barcelona striker Robert Lewandowski has announced he will not play for the Poland national team for as long as coach Michał Probierz remains in charge.

title: Sacked Spalletti will still coach Italy on Monday
content: Luciano Spalletti has been sacked from his role as Italy's coach, the manager said Sunday, following their heavy loss against Norway.

title: Mbappé, Olise earn France third in Nations League
content: Goals from captain Kylian Mbappé and Michael Olise earned France a 2-0 victory over Germany in Stuttgart on Sunday, and a third place finish in this season's UEFA Nations League.

title: Sources: Ramsey set for shock move to Mexico
content: Former Arsenal and Juventus midfielder Aaron Ramsey is set to complete a shock transfer to Mexican side Pumas UNAM, sources have told ESPN.

title: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's John Lennon shirt headlines NBA Finals Game 2 fits
content: The Indiana Pacers and Oklahoma City Thunder showed off the drip before Game 2 of the 2025 NBA Finals.

title: 'That's the Thundor dream': How one superfan contributes to OKC's 'free throw defense'
content: Garrett Haviland, also known as "Thundor," is at the forefront of what fans in OKC call "free throw defense."

title: NCAA athlete pay: Here's what's next
content: Schools will begin directly paying their athletes in less than a month, thanks to a legal settlement that was officially approved in federal court Friday. However, the situation is far from settled.

title: Jennifer Kupcho ends nearly three-year LPGA winless drought
content: Jennifer Kupcho closed with an 8-foot birdie putt in light rain to hold off Ilhee Lee on Sunday in the ShopRite LPGA Classic, ending a drought of nearly three years without winning.

title: Joaquin Niemann takes LIV Golf Virginia for fourth win in 2025
content: Joaquin Niemann of Chile won LIV Golf Virginia on Sunday for his fourth victory in the Saudi-funded tour's first eight events of the season.

title: Let's match top NBA draft prospects to pro players: Our 14 best comps in the 2025 class
content: ESPN's Jeremy Woo shares high- and low-end comparisons for projected lottery picks, including Cooper Flagg.

title: Meet the QBs in the 2026 NFL draft class: Strengths, weaknesses for 22 intriguing prospects
content: Will Cade Klubnik, LaNorris Sellers or Drew Allar be QB1 in next year's draft? And who are the other names to know in the class?

title: Pro softball is on deck! What to know about the inaugural AUSL season
content: The league will feature four teams and a touring model that will serve as a "tryout" for prospective home cities next season.

title: Will USL's move to pro-rel change U.S. soccer, threaten MLS?
content: USL's introduction of promotion-relegation could change U.S. soccer forever, but it's still unclear how it will work.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal plan fresh talks over €100m Sesko deal
content: Arsenal have scheduled another round of talks over signing RB Leipzig striker Benjamin Sesko. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Can Man United resolve Sancho, Rashford, Antony, Garnacho transfer stress?
content: As Man United try to rebuild, getting the wrong players out matters as much as getting the right ones in.

title: 2025 Mountain West Conference preview: Can Boise State do it again?
content: The Broncos, the Group of 5 standard-bearer, reached the CFP. They might be MWC favorites, but others in the league made big moves.

title: Chaos at Money in the Bank: Highlights from John Cena's farewell tour
content: Here are the best moments from John Cena's "The Last Time is Now" farewell tour, which kicked off at Intuit Dome on Jan. 6.

title: Meitei leader's arrest: Protests continue in Manipur defying prohibitory orders
content: Protests erupted across Manipur since Saturday (June 7) over the arrests of  Meitei outfit Arambai Tenggol leader Kanan Singh and four

title: Kerala shipwreck: State govt looks for insurance compensation instead of immediate criminal case against shipping company
content: General consensus in Kerala is that a criminal case need not be filed immediately and that the entire focus at this time should be on collecting evidence of damages so that evidence-based claims can be raised

title: Chhattisgath Additional SP killed, other cops injured in Sukma IED blast
content: Chhattigarh Deputy CM Vijay Sharma confirmed that ASP Akash Rao Giripunje was killed and expressed grief over his death.

title: India witnessed rapid transformations across diverse sectors in 11 years: PM Modi
content: A clear focus on good governance and transformation, PM Modi said of the last 11 years as his government finished the first year of its third term on June 9.

title: Bangalore University plans 2.5-km flyover to decrease traffic density in Jnanabharathi campus
content: Two years ago, a post-graduate student died in a bus accident on the campus, which led to students urging authorities to impose restrictions on public vehicle inside the campus

title: Ready to align with any party working for interest of Maharashtra: Aaditya Thackeray
content: The statement comes amid speculation of rapprochement between the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena (UBT) and his cousin Raj Thackeray's Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS)

title: Proposed air enclave a work in progress, set to boost Coast Guard’s capabilities: DG S. Paramesh
content: The new Coast Guard jetty at Vizhinjam is expected to enhance the Coast Guard’s operational preparedness significantly, the Flag Officer said.

title: Areas near Bhogapuram international airport witness real estate boom
content: In anticipation of huge demand for the properties in future, many real estate firms have been constructing villas, individual houses and apartments in Denkada, Natavalasa and other surrounding places of Bhogapuram airport region

title: What is the significance of the Census? | Explained
content: When was the first Census conducted? What are the two phases of the current Census exercise? Why is caste going to be enumerated in the upcoming Census? Why are southern States and some of the smaller States apprehensive about the Census exercise?

title: Sonam Raghuvanshi, the ‘missing’ wife among 4 arrested for Indore man’s murder during honeymoon in Meghalaya
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi surrendered in Uttar Pradesh; two others, suspected to be involved in Raja’s murder, were arrested in Madhya Pradesh

title: All-party parliamentary delegation led by Shashi Tharoor wraps up U.S. visit
content: The team, which had arrived from India in New York on May 24, had travelled to Guyana, Panama, Colombia and Brazil before arriving in Washington for the last leg of the tour

title: Assam flood situation improves marginally; 3 more deaths push toll to 26
content: No major river was flowing above the danger level in the State, with ferry services over the Brahmaputra resuming partially during the day

title: Congress leader Varsha Gaikwad stages protest against land transfer to Adani
content: Former Minister Varsha Gaikwad demanded to use the Mother Dairy land parcel for a botanical garden instead of a rehabilitation project

title: 75.67% candidates qualified APEAPCET-2025, says JNTU Kakinada VC
content: APEAPCET-2025 results are out; Probe in progress into the incidences of two mall practices, says Prof. Prasad

title: Flyovers won’t fix Hyderabad traffic, smarter road design can: Expert
content: “They [flyovers] are responses to induced demand, built primarily to accommodate the growing number of private vehicles,” urban transport expert Prashanth Kumar Bachu said

title: Private school managements threaten to withhold admissions until payment of pending fee reimbursement
content: They want the government to implement in letter and spirit Section 12 (1) (C) and Section 12 (2) of the Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act

title: Spirit of mutual respect will guide India, Bangladesh to work for people's wellbeing: Yunus
content: Mr Yunus’s letter was a response to Mr Modi’s message conveying Eid-ul-Adha greetings to Bangladeshi people and the interim chief adviser

title: Andhra Pradesh Home Minister Anitha condemns remarks against Amaravati, asks Jagan and his wife to apologise to people
content: The comments made by journalists on the TV channel owned by the YSRCP chief and his wife are not only offensive to the people, especially women and farmers of Amaravati, but are also deeply disrespectful to the State, she says, and promises legal action against those involved

title: Vegetable market in Tirupati gets CCTV cameras after complaints of drug abuse in its vicinity
content: Police appeal to the public to dial ‘112’ to alert them about any anti-social activity happening in their vicinity

title: Visa agent arrested for human trafficking, cheating woman seeking work in Muscat
content: The accused was identified as Satyanarayana, a native of Skinnerapuram village in West Godavari district

title: Decoding the Kamal-Kannada episode
content: Democratic opposition to views can be voiced, but issuing violent threats or denying someone their right to live must be treated as punishable crimes

title: Season 3 of Tamil Nadu Cycling League cyclothon concludes
content: Rancycers clinched the first place, followed by Trichy Rockfort Riders in the second position, and Namma Chennai Riders securing the third position

title: Revanth Reddy releases Bandaru Dattatreya’s autobiography, calls him ‘Ajata Shatruvu’
content: The Chief Minister also pointed out that leaders, cutting across the political lines, admire Dattatreya whether or not he holds power

title: Will bring Sandeshkhali perpetrators to justice after BJP comes to power in W.B., says Suvendu
content: Sheikh Shahjahan, former Trinamool Congress leader from Sandeshkhali block in North 24 Parganas district, faces allegations of land grab and sexual assault by several women in the region

title: Will develop cricket grounds in all districts: ACA president Sivanath
content: Presently, the Andhra Cricket Association is developing cricket grounds in Nellore and Kurnool , says MP Kesineni Sivanath while participating in the ACA’s 72nd Annual general body meeting

title: Aryanad police institute probe into marriage fraud
content: Ernakulam native Reshma is accused of duping at least ten men through marriage fraud over several years

title: Maharashtra, Karnataka account for 51% of FDI in India in FY25: Government
content: According to experts, the main reason for the maximum inflows in Maharashtra and Karnataka is substantial improvement in infrastructure

title: Swaraj’s friends, teachers rekindle his campus days magic
content: It provided a cherished opportunity for Mr. Swaraj’s friends and teachers to reconnect with him, reminiscing about old times and sharing laughter

title: Handover forest control to Centre, Union Minister Kurian tells Kerala govt.
content: . Kurian said that the central government was willing to amend the forest laws if the State hands over control of Kerala’s forests to the Centre.

title: Diet is both cause and cure for MASLD, a liver condition: experts at The Hindu-Naruvi event
content: MASLD is a lifestyle disease caused due to increased intake of food and decreased exercise; weight reduction is key to its management, say doctors

title: PMK founder Ramadoss hints at resolving stand-off with son Anbumani
content: PMK founder navigates power struggle with son Anbumani Ramadoss, seeking control over party operations.

title: Protester in Bangladesh student uprising of 2024 is a voter in W.B.’s Kakdwip
content: Newton Das, whose photos of being involved in Bangladesh revolution is available in public domain, says that he is a voter of Kakdwip Assembly seat in W.B. since 2014. His relatives say he has voting rights in both the countries

title: Extremely fortunate to be part of space mission, says Indian astronaut Shukla ahead of June 10 launch
content: Mr. Shukla will be the second Indian to travel to space, 41 years after his idol Rakesh Sharma undertook a spaceflight in 1984 onboard erstwhile Soviet Union's Soyuz spacecraft for an eight-day stay in orbit

title: Why is BJP chief speaking on behalf of Election Commission, asks Congress
content: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh tells the Election Commission to “be independent and transparent” and asked not to speak through BJP president Nadda

title: Be careful with your words, Shiv Sena MLA Nilesh Rane tells brother and BJP Minister Nitesh Rane
content: Mr. Nilesh Rane asked Mr. Nitesh Rane “not to forget that we are in alliance” over his remarks that the BJP is at the top, as Prime Minister at the Centre and the Chief Minister at the State are from the BJP.

title: K.C. Venugopal calls up Rajagopal Reddy as Congress leaders sulk over denial of berths
content: TPCC president Mahesh Goud and Minister Ponnam Prabhakar met senior leader Malreddy Ranga Reddy, who was also miffed at being overlooked

title: A village’s cry to keep a panchayat union primary school running in Tiruvallur
content: Vellambakkam Panchayat Union Primary School was built 20 years ago. Residents of this village say they fought hard to get a school established and a road laid. The enrolment was down to one student last year. The number of students has gone up to three this year. Residents attribute the problem to the dwindling population and the parents’ preference for private schools

title: Explosion On Singapore-Flagged Ship Off Kerala Coast, Navy Responds
content: An explosion was reported on board the Singapore-flagged container ship MV Wan Hai 503 off the coast of Kerala on Monday morning, a Defence PRO said.

title: Video: Late-Night Brawl With Stones Between 2 Groups In Bengaluru Over Girl
content: A dramatic video of a late-night clash between two groups allegedly over a woman has emerged in Bengaluru. In the blurry viral footage shot in Koramangala, the two groups were seen throwing stones at each other around 1:30 am.

title: World's Largest Container Ship Docks At Vizhinjam Seaport: What We Know
content: This was the vessel's first-ever visit to a South Asian port, showing the port's ability to handle Ultra-Large Container Vessels (ULCVs).

title: Meghalaya Honeymoon Murder: What We Know So Far
content: In a shocking twist, Sonam Raghuvanshi, the wife of Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi whose body was found deep in a gorge in Meghalaya, has been arrested for his murder.

title: Karan Adani Welcomes MSC IRINA, World's Largest Container Ship At Vizhinjam
content: The MSC IRINA, the world's largest container ship by TEU (Twenty-foot Equivalent Unit) capacity, made an entry into India on Monday and docked at the Adani Group's Vizhinjam International Seaport in Kerala.

title: India's $80 Billion Coal-Power Generation Goal Is Running Short Of Water
content: April marks the start of the cruelest months for residents of Solapur, a hot and dry district in western India. As temperatures soar, water availability dwindles. In peak summer, the wait for taps to flow can stretch to a week or more.

title: Watch: Cow Causes Chaos At Livestock Auction, Climbs Bleachers, Damages Roof
content: A cow caused chaos at a livestock auction in Decatur, Georgia, after it unexpectedly ran into the crowd, climbed up the top row of the bleachers, and damaged parts of the roof.

title: US Military Planted UFO, Area 51 Myths To Mask Classified Weapons: Report
content: The US Justice Department deliberately fuelled UFO conspiracy theories, including those centred around Area 51, to conceal Cold War-era military projects, a new report has revealed.

title: Sonam-Raja's Wedding Video Viral After Big Honeymoon Murder Reveal
content: Hours after a newly married Indore woman surrendered after allegedly getting her husband killed, a video of their wedding has emerged, showing a cheerful Raja Raghuvanshi applying sindoor on the forehead of Sonam.

title: Explainer: Does US Law Allow Trump To Send Troops To Quell Protests
content: Trump has deployed National Guard troops to California after two days of protests by hundreds of demonstrators against immigration raids, saying that the protests interfered with federal law enforcement.

title: Video: Moment Sonam Raghuvanshi, Accused Of Killing Husband, Was Found
content: Hours after she was arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Ghazipur, a video of Sonam Raghuvanshi has emerged. Ms Raghuvanshi, accused of killing her husband during their honeymoon in Meghalaya, was arrested from a dhaba.

title: Video: Australian Reporter Shot At While Covering Los Angeles Protests
content: An Australian journalist was shot with a rubber bullet while reporting on the anti-immigration protests in the United States' Los Angeles, with the incident caught live on camera.

title: What Ukraine's 'Creative' Spider's Web Drone Attack Taught NATO
content: Ukraine's "creativity", including its massive "Spider's web" drone attack deep inside Russia, holds profound lessons for Western militaries, the top NATO commander overseeing battlefield innovation said.

title: PM Modi Changed Country's Political Culture In These 11 Years: JP Nadda
content: BJP president J P Nadda on Monday hailed Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 11 years in office, saying the work done by the government under his leadership should be written in "golden letters".

title: Plane With 20 On Board Crashes In Tennessee: US Authorities
content: A plane carrying 20 people crashed in the US state of Tennessee on Sunday, with some on board taken to hospital for injuries, according to state and federal officials.

title: Manipur Highway Blockade Triggers Price Hike, Shortages
content: Prolonged highway blockades and disrupted transport routes have led to spiraling prices and critical shortages in Manipur, particularly in Churachandpur and the capital, Imphal, as residents continue to struggle.

title: What Happened In 1965 When US President Deployed National Guard
content: US President Donald Trump has deployed 2,000 National Guard troops to quell immigration protests in Los Angeles.

title: Opinion: Opinion | A Case For Decency - By Manoj K. Jha
content: The algorithms that drive social media platforms are designed to create echo chambers and amplify polarising content. When political leaders align themselves with such content, knowingly or otherwise, they risk deepening social divisions.

title: Two Indian Women Detained For Theft At Singapore's Changi Airport
content: Two Indian women transiting through Singapore's Changi Airport were detained for allegedly committing a series of shop thefts at different stores, police said on Monday.
